Australia: The transportation of convicts to Western Australia ceased.
Belgium: Walthère Frère-Orban replaces Charles Rogier as Prime Minister
47 miners killed by a fire damp explosion in the Sainte Henriette mine near Jemappes.
Frederick Doulton, MP, brought to trial in Brussels on charges of fraud in public works, but acquitted of having broken any law.
Brazil: Paraguayan War: Brazilian Army commander Luís Alves de Lima e Silva, Duke of Caxias enters Asunción, Paraguay's capital. Some days later he declares the war is over. Nevertheless, Francisco Solano López, Paraguay's president, prepares guerrillas to fight in the countryside.
Paraguayan War: Battle of Ytororó or Ytororó: Field-Marshal Luís Alves de Lima e Silva, Duke of Caxias leads 13,000 Brazilian troops against a Paraguayan fortified position of 5,000 troops.
China: Yangzhou riot: Scholar-officials resident in Yangzhou instigated a riot in which the headquarters of the British missionary society OMF International were attacked and burned.
Nian Rebellion: The last of the rebel armies was destroyed.
Colombia: Santos Gutiérrez is President of the United States of Colombia
Cuba: The first war of Cuban independence, also known as the Ten Years' War, begins. It lasts until 1878.
Revolutionaries under the leadership of Carlos Manuel de Céspedes proclaim Cuban independence.
England: The last public execution was carried out.
Indinesia: The Batavian Museum (today National Museum of Indonesia) was officially opened by Dutch East Indies government.
Japan: Boshin War resulting in Meiji Restoration and other events
Russia: The Khanate of Kokand became a Russian vassal state.
Spain: Ten Years' War: A war with Cuba began.
Taiwan: Camphor War: British Navy occupies Anping over rights to export camphor without regard for Chinese regulations
Camphor War: Qing dynasty gives in to British demands for reparations, freedom of missionary activity, and trade rights
John Dodd calls in British gunboats to force Qing authorities to apologize and pay reparations for being accosted by an angry crowd
Tajikistan: Most of Tajikistan was incorporated into the Russian Empire.
USA: Impeachment of Andrew Johnson: Johnson is impeached by the House, but acquitted by the Senate.
The Fourteenth Amendment to the United States Constitution, second of the Reconstruction Amendments, is ratified.
